Title

Overview
-----

Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC) invites interested suppliers to bid on a procurement for Argo free drifting profiling floats. The procurement aims to support the Government of Canada's contribution to the International Argo Program, which is a key component of the Global Ocean Observing System.

Notice Amendments
-----------------

The solicitation closing date has been amended from January 26th, 2024 to February 2nd, 2024. 

Background
----------

Argo is a standard for global ocean observing systems, developed to function as a global network with international collaboration. The Department of Fisheries and Oceans Canada (DFO) requires Argo floats to be delivered to their facilities in Nova Scotia and British Columbia.

Objectives
----------

* Procure Argo profiling floats to support the Government of Canada's contribution to the International Argo Program
* Deliver floats to DFO facilities in Dartmouth and Sydney

##### Specifications 

Two configurations are required:
1. Float equipped with SBE CTD sensor to support the Core Argo program
2. Float equipped with RBR CTD sensor to support the Core Argo program

Green Procurement
-----------------

PWGSC encourages suppliers to use environmentally preferable packaging for all packaged goods to be delivered to the end-user.

Eligibility
------------

All interested suppliers may submit a bid. Trade agreements apply, as per the Government of Canada's Trade Agreements.

Delivery 
----------

The procurement includes an anticipated delivery date. The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.
